comments:
The problem is the initialization of the logger within RSECorePlugin.start(). As LoggerFactory.getLogger(this) triggers a lot of other code to be called, the invoked code once returns to RSECorePlugin via RSECorePlugin.getLocalMachineName() (see stacktrace for details). But if _anything_ is going wrong with querying the local machine name and the call _does_ throw an exception, _whole_ RSE will be screwed as in that state, RSECorePlugin is _not_ in activated state and the error handling via "getDefault().log(e)" ends up in a NullPointerException. :-(

org.osgi.framework.BundleException: Exception in org.eclipse.rse.core.RSECorePlugin.start() of bundle org.eclipse.rse.core.
